test.name: Go to the Cross-Platform Feature Test Report dashboard on BlueMix

kw.name: Open Browser to Cross-Platform Feature Test Report
Open Browser
kw.doc: Opens a new browser instance to given URL.

kw.name: Maximize Browser Window
kw.doc: Maximizes current browser window.

kw.name: Set Selenium Speed
kw.doc: Sets the delay in seconds that is waited after each Selenium command.

test.name: Check the status of the most recent Cross-Platform Feature Test run

kw.name: A Python automation framework analyzed the Cross-Platform Feature Test Report dashboard
Set Test Documentation
kw.doc: Sets documentation for the current test case.

arguments.arg: This step will analyze the results of the Cross-Platform Feature Test run (it tests Windows 10 Edge browser, Mac OS X Safari browser, and iPhone 6 resolution) displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard3-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of passes is not displayed as "Pass 14" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message. This means that failures were found by the Cross-Platform Feature Test run and it should be investigated. All of these tests are recorded and uploaded to http://screencast-o-matic.com/u/UxC/ci please ask Joshua Gorospe for the password to log into the channel. In the future, an automated process will monitor this dashboard and send out notifications to the QA Team.

kw.msg: Set test documentation to: This step will analyze the results of the Cross-Platform Feature Test run (it tests Windows 10 Edge browser, Mac OS X Safari browser, and iPhone 6 resolution) displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard3-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of passes is not displayed as "Pass 14" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message. This means that failures were found by the Cross-Platform Feature Test run and it should be investigated. All of these tests are recorded and uploaded to http://screencast-o-matic.com/u/UxC/ci please ask Joshua Gorospe for the password to log into the channel. In the future, an automated process will monitor this dashboard and send out notifications to the QA Team.

kw.name: Set Selenium Timeout
kw.doc: Sets the timeout in seconds used by various keywords.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.

kw.name: Capture Page Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot of the current page and embeds it into the log.

kw.msg: Text 'Pass 14' did not appear in 2 seconds

test.doc: This step will analyze the results of the Cross-Platform Feature Test run (it tests Windows 10 Edge browser, Mac OS X Safari browser, and iPhone 6 resolution) displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard3-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of passes is not displayed as "Pass 14" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message. This means that failures were found by the Cross-Platform Feature Test run and it should be investigated. All of these tests are recorded and uploaded to http://screencast-o-matic.com/u/UxC/ci please ask Joshua Gorospe for the password to log into the channel. In the future, an automated process will monitor this dashboard and send out notifications to the QA Team.

tags.tag: Windows 10 Edge browser, Mac OS X Safari browser, iPhone 6 resolution (Chrome Developer Tools) tests

test.status: Text 'Pass 14' did not appear in 2 seconds

test.name: Go to the Smoke Test Automation Test Results Summary dashboard on BlueMix

kw.name: Open Browser to Smoke Test Automation Test Results Summary
Open Browser
kw.doc: Opens a new browser instance to given URL.

kw.name: Maximize Browser Window
kw.doc: Maximizes current browser window.

kw.name: Set Selenium Speed
kw.doc: Sets the delay in seconds that is waited after each Selenium command.

test.name: Check the status of the most recent Smoke Test Automation Test Results Summary

kw.name: A Python automation framework analyzed the Smoke Test Automation Test Results Summary dashboard
Set Test Documentation
kw.doc: Sets documentation for the current test case.

arguments.arg: This step will analyze the results of the Cell 2, Cell 3 and Cell 4 Smoke Test Automation run displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard1-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of failures is not displayed as "Steps Failed : 0" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message. This means that failures were found by the Cell 2, Cell 3 and Cell 4 Smoke Test Automation run and it should be investigated. In the future, an automated process will monitor this dashboard and send out notifications to the QA Team.

kw.msg: Set test documentation to: This step will analyze the results of the Cell 2, Cell 3 and Cell 4 Smoke Test Automation run displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard1-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of failures is not displayed as "Steps Failed : 0" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message. This means that failures were found by the Cell 2, Cell 3 and Cell 4 Smoke Test Automation run and it should be investigated. In the future, an automated process will monitor this dashboard and send out notifications to the QA Team.

kw.name: Set Selenium Timeout
kw.doc: Sets the timeout in seconds used by various keywords.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.

kw.name: Capture Page Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot of the current page and embeds it into the log.

kw.msg: Text 'Steps Failed : 0' did not appear in 2 seconds

test.doc: This step will analyze the results of the Cell 2, Cell 3 and Cell 4 Smoke Test Automation run displayed here http://qa-ci-dashboard1-joshua-gorospe.mybluemix.net/ . If this step detects that the total number of failures is not displayed as "Steps Failed : 0" in the BlueMix dashboard, then the Status message in this step will display a red "FAIL" message.
